update.description:

It is marked as WIP because I would like to test that the messages are published properly, I need to check that and also see how can I test it properly.

It requires [some chages in ign-sensors](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/29/changes-required-for-ing-gazebo-for-gpu/diff).

I also need to merge with default. If you want I can ping you when I am done.

I am preparing the demo and some stuff keeps appearing, for example we need to pass the frame to the sensor so it adds this information to the LaserScan message.

I also need to merge with default. If you want I can ping you when I am done.

content.raw: I am preparing a demo world with a lidar and a camera to be used with ros bridge. While I was doing that I noticed that the RTF reported when using the lidar drops to ~50% but htop shows me that it doesn’t look like a CPU issue.
content.html: I am preparing a demo world with a lidar and a camera to be used with ros bridge. While I was doing that I noticed that the RTF reported when using the lidar drops to ~50% but htop shows me that it doesn’t look like a CPU issue.

content.raw: the collision size is different from visual, which is probably done on purpose so that the camera does not fall. We could just make this model `static`.
content.html: the collision size is different from visual, which is probably done on purpose so that the camera does not fall. We could just make this model static.

pullrequest.title: [A-2] Add  gpu ray sensor to ign-gazebo

content.raw: The reason that the gpu lidar sensor in the integration test is producing `inf` is that the sensor pose is being updated here and also in ign-sensors. We should probably [remove those SetWorld\* calls](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/src/44478d338c57678adae77f61139ffabdde3df6d8/src/GpuLidarSensor.cc#lines-185) in GpuLidarSensor.cc
content.html: The reason that the gpu lidar sensor in the integration test is producing inf is that the sensor pose is being updated here and also in ign-sensors. We should probably remove those SetWorld* calls in GpuLidarSensor.cc
